metadata.Title: CVE-2018-1999014 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description: FFmpeg before commit bab0716c7f4793ec42e05a5aa7e80d82a0dd4e75 contains an out of array access vulnerability in MXF format demuxer that can result in DoS. This attack appear to be exploitable via specially crafted MXF file which has to be provided as input. This vulnerability appears to have been fixed in bab0716c7f4793ec42e05a5aa7e80d82a0dd4e75 and later.

notes.Note: mdeslaur> marking chromium-browser as ignored, since we do full-version updates, and rely on upstream's bundled ffmpeg version

criterions.comment: chromium-browser: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
gst-libav1.0: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
kino: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
qtwebengine-opensource-src: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
